Entries.info: Sends a PWM command to the motor.  The acceptable range is [-1, 1].  If the motor spins for a short time then stops and beeps the timeout limit was reached.  Change the timeout to test (and change it back when done).
Sends a voltage command to the motor.  If the motor spins for a short time then stops and beeps the timeout limit was reached.  Change the timeout to test (and change it back when done).
Sends a velocity command to the motor.  If the motor spins for a short time then stops and beeps the timeout limit was reached.  Change the timeout to test (and change it back when done).

Simulates an input from a flight controller to an ESC.  0 corresponds to 1000us, and 1 corresponds to 2000us.  If the motor spins for a short time then stops and beeps the timeout limit was reached.  Change the timeout to test (and change it back when done).
Puts the motor into coast mode.  The motor will gently decelerate to zero velocity.
Puts the motor into brake mode.  The motor will quickly decelerate to zero velocity.
Reports the error code of the last CAN failure. 0 means no error
Counter that increments with CAN receive errors
Counter that increments with CAN transmit errors
Bit indicating if the bus turned itself off due to errors. If the bit is 1, the bus is off.
Bit indicating if the error limit to enter passive mode has been reached. 1 means we are past the passive error limit
Bit indicating if the error warning limit has been reached. 1 indicates we have had enough errors to trigger a warning
